snippet: The Assad government denied the report, but activists posted video online of medics in gas masks dousing victims with water and of children in hospitals.
abstract: Chlorine bombs, reportedly dropped by Syrian government forces, kill six people in Idlib Province.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The Assad government denied the report, but activists posted video online of medics in gas masks dousing victims with water and of children in hospitals.

headline.main: Syrian Activists Say Chlorine Gas Attack Kills 6 in Idlib Province
headline.print_headline: Fatal Chemical Attack Reported in Syria

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
